name: BBQ Roasted Chicken
description: So easy to prepare using just pantry spices making the best smoky BBQ rub ever! And the chicken comes out with perfectly crispy skin!

recipeInstructions.text: In a small bowl, combine salt, paprika, chili powder, pepper, garlic powder, onion powder, thyme, cumin and mustard.
recipeInstructions.name: In a small bowl, combine salt, paprika, chili powder, pepper, garlic powder, onion powder, thyme, cumin and mustard.

recipeInstructions.text: Remove giblets and excess fat from the chicken cavity. Dry chicken thoroughly with paper towels. Season chicken and chicken cavity with paprika mixture.
recipeInstructions.name: Remove giblets and excess fat from the chicken cavity. Dry chicken thoroughly with paper towels. Season chicken and chicken cavity with paprika mixture.

recipeInstructions.text: Place chicken, breast side up, on a rack in a shallow roasting pan; tie drumsticks together with kitchen twine; set aside.
recipeInstructions.name: Place chicken, breast side up, on a rack in a shallow roasting pan; tie drumsticks together with kitchen twine; set aside.

recipeInstructions.text: Place into oven and roast until the chicken is golden brown and completely cooked through, reaching an internal temperature of 165 degrees F, about 1 hour. Let rest 10-15 minutes.
recipeInstructions.name: Place into oven and roast until the chicken is golden brown and completely cooked through, reaching an internal temperature of 165 degrees F, about 1 hour. Let rest 10-15 minutes.

review.reviewBody: I made this recipe tonight (5 lb chicken, so increased the seasonings by a pinch). I am not crazy about cumin, but wanting to trust the authenticity of the recipe, I kept it in. Let me just say… the Chicken is AMAZING!!! I was afraid it would be dry, but it is not dry at all. The flavor profiles, with the bbq sauce I used on mine, so good! If you’re looking for a tasty, juicy chicken recipe, with a crispy skin, try this one. You won’t be disappointed!
Such a great blend of seasonings. This was one of the easiest whole chicken recipes that I've made. Biggest difference is that we actually finished the entire bird.
